pull_request.title: xrServerEntities: Initialize `freezed` member to `false`
pull_request.body: The uninitialized value would be loaded on line [1029](https://github.com/OpenXRay/xray-16/blob/dev/src/xrServerEntities/xrServer_Objects_ALife.cpp#L1029) inside `UPDATE_Read` resulting in undefined behavior and a non deterministic value assigned to `prev_freezed`.

issue.title: Reference binding to null pointer in `resptr_core` related to shaders
issue.body:
Running with the undefined behavior sanitizer and launching CoP on Linux we get the following report.
```
/mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrCore/xr_resource.h:118:39: runtime error: reference binding to null pointer of type 'struct SMatrixList'
    #0 0x7f08e49bc899 in resptr_core<SMatrixList, resptr_base<SMatrixList> >::operator*() const /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrCore/xr_resource.h:118
    #1 0x7f08e497fd44 in CBackend::set_Matrices(resptr_core<SMatrixList, resptr_base<SMatrixList> >&) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend.h:353
    #2 0x7f08e4980390 in CBackend::set_Pass(SPass*) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend_Runtime.h:146
    #3 0x7f08e49809ab in CBackend::set_Pass(resptr_core<SPass, resptr_base<SPass> >&) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend.h:356
    #4 0x7f08e4980a4a in CBackend::set_Element(ShaderElement*, unsigned int) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend_Runtime.h:149
    #5 0x7f08e4980a4a in CBackend::set_Element(resptr_core<ShaderElement, resptr_base<ShaderElement> >&, unsigned int) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend.h:359
    #6 0x7f08e4a87266 in CBackend::set_Shader(Shader*, unsigned int) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend_Runtime.h:150
    #7 0x7f08e4a87266 in CBackend::set_Shader(resptr_core<Shader, resptrcode_shader>&, unsigned int) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/R_Backend.h:362
    #8 0x7f08e4b5eb5a in dxUIRender::SetShader(IUIShader&) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender/dxUIRender.cpp:25
    #9 0x7f08d15c82d4 in CUIStaticItem::Render() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrUICore/Static/UIStaticItem.cpp:181
    #10 0x7f08d15ca08e in CUIStatic::DrawTexture() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrUICore/Static/UIStatic.cpp:141
    #11 0x7f08d15b643c in CUIStatic::Draw() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrUICore/Static/UIStatic.cpp:70
    #12 0x7f08d1635d31 in CUIWindow::Draw() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrUICore/Windows/UIWindow.cpp:32
    #13 0x7f08d15b6449 in CUIStatic::Draw() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrUICore/Static/UIStatic.cpp:71
    #14 0x7f08d1635d31 in CUIWindow::Draw() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrUICore/Windows/UIWindow.cpp:32
    #15 0x7f08d66b3723 in CDialogHolder::DoRenderDialogs() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrGame/UIDialogHolder.cpp:146
    #16 0x7f08d5dc6a35 in CMainMenu::OnRenderPPUI_main() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrGame/MainMenu.cpp:512
    #17 0x7f08d59c0131 in CGamePersistent::OnRenderPPUI_main() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrGame/GamePersistent.cpp:803
    #18 0x7f08e4deceb6 in CRender::RenderMenu() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/Layers/xrRender_R2/r2_R_render.cpp:22
    #19 0x7f08d5dc6804 in CMainMenu::OnRender() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrGame/MainMenu.cpp:492
    #20 0x7f08f3438a39 in pureRender::OnPure(pureRender*) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/pure.h:20
    #21 0x7f08f3438a39 in MessageRegistry<pureRender>::Process() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/pure.h:101
    #22 0x7f08f34459ab in CRenderDevice::DoRender() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/device.cpp:236
    #23 0x7f08f3445c76 in CRenderDevice::ProcessFrame() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/device.cpp:268
    #24 0x7f08f3446767 in CRenderDevice::message_loop() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/device.cpp:410
    #25 0x7f08f344699b in CRenderDevice::Run() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/device.cpp:443
    #26 0x7f08f3418daa in Startup() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/main.cpp:310
    #27 0x7f08f341a9bb in RunApplication() /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xrEngine/main.cpp:366
    #28 0x4017d0 in entry_point(char const*) /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xr_3da/entry_point.cpp:95
    #29 0x401ab0 in main /mnt/data/dev/xray-16/src/xr_3da/entry_point.cpp:151
    #30 0x7f08f1c45ccf  (/usr/lib/libc.so.6+0x27ccf) (BuildId: 8bfe03f6bf9b6a6e2591babd0bbc266837d8f658)
    #31 0x7f08f1c45d89 in __libc_start_main (/usr/lib/libc.so.6+0x27d89) (BuildId: 8bfe03f6bf9b6a6e2591babd0bbc266837d8f658)
    #32 0x401344 in _start (/mnt/data/dev/xray-16/bin/x64/Debug/xr_3da+0x401344) (BuildId: 47412f474ca5986f54e0cd92bf2a368085964a3a)
```

But it can also be triggered with the following patch without the sanitizer
```patch
diff --git a/src/xrCore/xr_resource.h b/src/xrCore/xr_resource.h
index a659caa65..22427a834 100644
--- a/src/xrCore/xr_resource.h
+++ b/src/xrCore/xr_resource.h
@@ -115,7 +115,7 @@ public:
     }
 
     // accessors
-    T& operator*() const { return *C::p_; }
+    T& operator*() const { R_ASSERT(C::p_); return *C::p_; }
     T* operator->() const { return C::p_; }
     // unspecified bool type
     typedef T* (resptr_core::*unspecified_bool_type)() const;
```

Tried to take a look at it but not sure whats going on here.

pages.title: [EN] How to build and setup on Windows

commits.message:
MSBuild: Bump default Visual Studio version to 2022

Visual Studio 2019 is still supported.

Dropped support for Visual Studio 2017. This simplifies us Windows SDK
automatic selection, no more hacks in project configuration files.
This also means dropping Windows SDK 8.1 support.
xrRender_R4: use DirectXTex to generate mipped noise texture

Layers/xrRenderDX11/dx11Texture.cpp: moved log message a bit lower
Small formatting changes

xrRender_R4: use DirectXTex to load textures

Finally get rid of D3DX in DX11 renderer.

xrRender: isolate D3DX include in DX9 renderers
(include only when needed, not in the precompiled header)

commits.message:
CMake: Add option to enable link-time-optimizations (LTO)

The option to enable LTO can be controlled with the `USE_LTO` option and
defaults to true for master gold builds.

Merge pull request #1472 from AMS21/cmake_lto

Add option to enable link-time-optimizations (LTO)

pull_request.title: Add option to enable link-time-optimizations (LTO)
pull_request.body:
The option to enable LTO can be controlled with the `USE_LTO` option and defaults to true for master gold builds.

Here are some quick comparisons of build sizes.

gcc-13 without LTO
```
  240216 cximage.a
  922028 libGameSpy-oxr.a
  108906 libxrMiscMath.a
  209776 libxrQSlim.a
  744312 xrAICore.so
    7696 xrAPI.so
  326016 xrCDB.so
  715752 xrCore.so
 2421024 xrEngine.so
62433720 xrGame.so
  119114 xrGameSpy.a
 1788920 xrImGui.a
   13360 xrLCUtil.so
   91816 xrLuaFix.a
  200288 xrLuabind.so
  603632 xrLuajit.so
  112648 xrNetServer.so
  462824 xrODE.a
  282024 xrOPCODE.a
  213520 xrParticles.so
 1598100 xrPhysics.a
 3868192 xrRender_GL.so
  574800 xrScriptEngine.so
  203936 xrSound.so
 3023560 xrUICore.so
   13920 xr_3da
```

gcc-13 with LTO
```
  664330 cximage.a
 3044020 libGameSpy-oxr.a
  243626 libxrMiscMath.a
  864204 libxrQSlim.a
  559176 xrAICore.so
    7664 xrAPI.so
  287112 xrCDB.so
  684960 xrCore.so
 2296960 xrEngine.so
44586664 xrGame.so
  479566 xrGameSpy.a
 4171622 xrImGui.a
   13392 xrLCUtil.so
  248422 xrLuaFix.a
  173480 xrLuabind.so
  620768 xrLuajit.so
  103936 xrNetServer.so
 1251242 xrODE.a
  881210 xrOPCODE.a
  204568 xrParticles.so
 5107958 xrPhysics.a
 3621848 xrRender_GL.so
  511456 xrScriptEngine.so
  198304 xrSound.so
 2412224 xrUICore.so
   13736 xr_3da
```

clang-17 without LTO
```
  245132 cximage.a
  916508 libGameSpy-oxr.a
  118058 libxrMiscMath.a
  243736 libxrQSlim.a
  692336 xrAICore.so
    4272 xrAPI.so

 2508680 xrEngine.so
59053256 xrGame.so

 2084626 xrImGui.a

  245354 xrOPCODE.a
  186592 xrParticles.so
 1524302 xrPhysics.a
 3829064 xrRender_GL.so
  496528 xrScriptEngine.so
  188968 xrSound.so
 2912528 xrUICore.so
   11272 xr_3da
```

```

  916508 libGameSpy-oxr.a
```

issue.title: Support for Anomaly

labels.name: Call of Pripyat
labels.description: This can affect Call of Pripyat compatibility, or related to this game.

labels.name: Mods
labels.description: This issue is related to mods.

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good start for beginners that want to contribute.

issue.body:
**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
I would like to create a new branch and adapt this engine for Stalker Anomaly, since its own fork is only contains game-logic changes but the performance is awful.

**Describe the solution you'd like**
Create new branch `/anomaly` and apply/refactor changes from here: https://bitbucket.org/anomalymod/xray-monolith/commits/ to make this fork compatible with **Anomaly** mod.

**Additional context**
I believe this will benefit both the playerbase and the team of this fork, due to the increased popularity.

comment.body:
> @mbehm, one thing to make sure: did you compared Anomaly against [SeargeDP's CoC x64](https://bitbucket.org/SeargeDP/coc-1.4-xray-64) repository?

Yes the diffs are based on that and the current demonized xray-monolith repository.

pull_request.title: GitHub Actions: Add workflow to check file encoding

Part of #1474 

Glad to report that all source files in the repository are currently correctly encoded as utf-8 and don't contain windows encoding.

We workflow will ensure that no future files change this.

issue.title: Refactor `script_game_object` money functions to use u32

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good start for beginners that want to contribute.

issue.body:
Since `CInventoryOwner` already stored `money` as a `u32` it only makes since for us to also treat it like one.

Also fixed a logic bug which would have allowed the object to transfer money which it didn't have.

Since both values are unsigned subtracting them from another will never
produce a negative value.

This bug was also present before changing the function signature since the `money`
variable was implicitly converted to an `u32` resulting in the same problem.

comment.body:
> So, does that fix #1173 by the way?

Well not really. You don't get negative money. The money transfer just does not happen but the dialog still works and you get the information just without losing money.

issue.title: Refactor `script_game_object` money functions to use u32

labels.name: good first issue
labels.description: Good start for beginners that want to contribute.

issue.body:
Since `CInventoryOwner` already stored `money` as a `u32` it only makes since for us to also treat it like one.

Also fixed a logic bug which would have allowed the object to transfer money which it didn't have.

Since both values are unsigned subtracting them from another will never
produce a negative value.

This bug was also present before changing the function signature since the `money`
variable was implicitly converted to an `u32` resulting in the same problem.

issue.title: Refactor `script_game_object` money functions to use u32
issue.body:
Since `CInventoryOwner` already stored `money` as a `u32` it only makes since for us to also treat it like one.

Also fixed a logic bug which would have allowed the object to transfer money which it didn't have.

Since both values are unsigned subtracting them from another will never
produce a negative value.

This bug was also present before changing the function signature since the `money`
variable was implicitly converted to an `u32` resulting in the same problem.

comment.body: So, does that fix #1173 by the way?

issue.title: Fix and enforce code style regarding spaces
issue.body:
As discussed in #1474 this is the first part regarding spaces.

We now enforce:
1. No tabs only spaces except in C++ source code
2. No trailing spaces
3. Files must end with a newline

These rules are now check with the help of the new `stylecheck` github workflow.

Currently we check everything that ends in one of the following file extensions.
- `.h`
- `.hpp`
- `.inl`
- `.c`
- `.cpp`
- `.cs`
- `.rc`
- `.yaml`
- `.yml`
- `.md`
- `.txt`
- `.cmake`
- `.sh`

While the following path are ignored
- `External/`
- `src/_CppDependOut/`
- `sdk`
- `src/utils/mp_gpprof_server/libraries`
- `res`

Here an example of what the output of the workflow run would look like if you added code which violates these checks.

![Sample](https://github.com/OpenXRay/xray-16/assets/19614997/d395c87f-07f6-431a-a75a-4c80881afc7d)
